p: Ethanol forms the base for traditional perfumes available on the market, since it is the solvent of hydrophobic aromatic substances. Depending on the contents of a fragrance composition, we distinguish between eau de parfum which contains 10–15% of a fragrance composition, eau de toilette which contains 5–10% of a fragrance composition, and eau de cologne which contains 3–5% of a fragrance composition [ 1, 2]. Unfortunately, people prone to allergies or with sensitive skin, who use ethanol-based perfumes, may suffer from skin irritation and inflammation because ethanol is a solvent with a defined irritating potential [ 3].
